name: Oaks Mon Komo

reviews.text: Tremendous sea views. Very fast book in service. The room (actually a one bedroom suite) was ultra modern with a kitchen that I'd be proud to have in our own home, and there was so much space in every room! We obviously got the accommodation on an introductory rate of $129 for two nights because it was top class accommodation, luxuriously appointed, When we walked in to the room, we both said "wow!". For Brisbane, that was probably the cheapest you'll pay anywhere.The car park is secure and a fast lift takes you straight up to your room. The rooms are secure (not that you need it) because the card only allows residents access to their own floor. There are no porters, but given the parking arrangements, you really don't need them.
reviews.title: We'll be back.

reviews.text: It's quite a drive from Redcliffe to the CBD, but if you have a car, it doesn't matter much. While I went to work, my wife has a ball strolling around the boutique shops along the beachfront. Redcliffe itself has come a long way. They have actually imported sand and, apart from the pool, there is a safe clean swimming area on the beachfront. The atmosphere is great, and it's peaceful with a holiday feel to it.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there is stress free compared to driving in the CBD. Overall, we were delighted with the experience.
reviews.title: A Bench Mark For Others To Aspire to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is brand new and quite nicely appointed. The rooms are a generous size and the beds are quite comfy. My room was on the top floor facing Redcliffe, and the night lights view was great. I had an issue with the phone whilst I was there, but because there is only one person on reception at night & no other staff, nothing could be done. The reception ladies were lovely on the weekend, but not really hotel experienced. Rooms were clean and the inclusions were of a high standard. I would definately recommend this hotel & it's downstairs bar/eating area.
reviews.title: What a disappointment.

reviews.text: The sea view from our 12th floor apartment and the sunset over Moreton Bay was to die for. This apartment dripped luxury and I suspect anyone who faults this place is not living in the real world. Complete laundry, kitchen with dish draw (1/2 height dish washer) and full cooking facilities. Great electronics entertainment package complete with iPod docking, a lovely arrangement of sliding floor to ceiling panels which allowed one to adapt the space or privacy as needs changed. I spend a lot of time researching where I stay and as a result file very few negative reports so I am pleased to say that this choice received straight A’s. To complete the compliments the reception staff were extremely kind even to the extent of setting up my Toll Road account on the internet for me. This is a bench mark site to judge others by.
reviews.title: A lovely find

reviews.text: Saturday 4 February we checked out the Restaurant at Mon Komo. My two sisters and I had just spent time at a Nursing home celebrating my fathers birthday who has Dementia and were in need for some lunch (and a drink). We were greeted with friendly staff and a lovely young man took us to a the table or our choice. It was my first time at Oaks Mon Komo and I was very impressed with the decor. The staff was very attentive and we ordered a nice white wine. The meals were reasonably priced and there was a good choice. The food was excellent, service great and I really enjoyed the decor. We are returning this Friday night with a group to celebrate a birthday.
reviews.title: Great Restaurant experience - will be returning

reviews.text: All Apartments have full kitchen and laundry facilities. Rooms were big and clean. Very friendly staff that even worked with me to refund a night when I had to check out early. Located across the road from Suttons Beach and a great trail for running or walking along the beach. Just across the street from Woolworths and Outback Jacks and so much more.
reviews.title: Excellent Apartments.....Great Location

reviews.text: At first glance the resort looked promising but the cold disinterested staff, unclean room including (but not limited to) recent blood stains on the bedding, dirty shower screen and bathroom floor, being directed out in foul weather to find food with no mention that the resort had a restaurant on the same premises, totally spoiled the experience. An email to the manager followed up with a phone call to check the email had been received elicited no response. This would explain the disinterested unwelcoming attitude from the reception staff - it always flows down from the top.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The appartments in this complex are standard, there is nothing special about the building.
reviews.title: Just an average appartment complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area is just the normal souless hall.
reviews.title: Best balcony ever!

reviews.text: We met local Redcliffe friends at the new Mon Komo Hotel, Redcliffe for lunch. The setting of the Hotel is lovely,however the resturant was a great dissapointment. The food is pub/club style but the prices match some of the better Brisbane restaurants. When our coffee was served it arrived luke-warm (we don't live in Italy). We were told they were having trouble with the expresso machine so we asked for another that was just a little better. The real upset was the bill. I always make a point of checking resturants bills. I could see straight away there was lot of food and drink charges that were not ours. When I asked to see the supervisor I was told the bills were hard to read, but the bill was correct!!! We were a table of 4 and charged for 6 meals and many drinks and other additions that we did not order. There was a $70 mistake. I asked for a new bill but apparently that was impossible because it would entail crediting and re-entering the data, and it was all too much trouble. The Supervisor attended the table and said the meals and drinks had been deducted from the bill. I was so upset I am still not sure it we paid the right amount. Not good enough Mon Komo Hotel.
reviews.title: RESTURANT...... A GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mon Komo is a terrific concept high quality apartment style accommodation. The developers are to be congratulated for taking the plunge into the expensive and much needed gentrification of the Redcliffe area. The trouble is that the locals also take the plunge in the new public swimming lagoon located on the beach front immediately below and the noise goes on ALL DAY AND NIGHT! There is no way to really shut out the noise of local yahoos who like to take a dip at 3am in the morning including weekdays. You can hear all that they say and we were on the eighth floor!
reviews.title: Spacious and new but overlooks public swimming pool

reviews.text: Overall, top quality accommodation with shops so close, but we will consider our options if going back to the area and see what else is around.
reviews.title: Beautiful clean rooms with great ocean view

reviews.text: I stayed in a one bedroom over looking the ocean, it was beautiful! The rooms were clean and new, with everything you needed. There was underground carparking which was at no extra charge. I will stay again! For work or a holiday, these apartments are very new.
reviews.title: Love the Restaurant & bar !! Great venue.

reviews.text: Have now been several times to the Restaurant/bar with Family & Friends & we all just love it.
reviews.title: Worth it's price, staff are brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Oaks Mon Komo via a groupon special and were extremely impressed with the quality of the apartment.
reviews.title: Fantastic apartment

reviews.text: We were lucky to have been allocated the top floor and had fantastic ocean views over to Moreton Island.
reviews.title: Nice and new, but the service? Meh!
Great Experience
reviews.text: The furniture and decor in this apartment are really fantastic, in particular the huge balcony with dining suite and lounge suite.
The bed was extremely comfortable and I loved the pillows so much I have looked them up online to purchase.
reviews.title: Great for families with young kids

reviews.text: We weren't exactly excited about Recliffe, not much to do except the trip over to Moreton island, so we were glad to have a lovely luxurious apartment to relax in. Many hours spent lying on the balcony lounge reading.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

description: Mon Komo "My Dream Place" on the beach at Redcliffe is the newest resort style accommodation located only 35 minutes from Brisbane’s CBD precinct and close to Brisbane Domestic & International airports. Surrounded by restaurants, cafes, shopping, entertainment, recreational activities and only moments to the beach there is plenty to see and do whilst staying at Mon Komo. With all the facilities of a beachfront resort you can be sure to enjoy the luxury of Mon Komo's spacious hotel rooms and fully self contained apartments, most with spectacular ocean views over Moreton Bay. Spacious apartments complemented by contemporary coastal decor & luxuriously appointed kitchens with stainless steel appliances and full laundry facilities.
